location: Camp near Sardis. Before BRUTUS's tent.

lines.text: Drum. Enter BRUTUS, LUCILIUS, LUCIUS, and Soldiers; TITINIUS and PINDARUS meeting them

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Stand, ho!

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: Give the word, ho! and stand.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: What now, Lucilius! is Cassius near?

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: He is at hand; and Pindarus is come To do you salutation from his master.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: He greets me well. Your master, Pindarus, In his own change, or by ill officers, Hath given me some worthy cause to wish Things done, undone: but, if he be at hand, I shall be satisfied.

lines.speaker: pindarus
lines.text: I do not doubt But that my noble master will appear Such as he is, full of regard and honour.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: He is not doubted. A word, Lucilius; How he received you, let me be resolved.

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: With courtesy and with respect enough; But not with such familiar instances, Nor with such free and friendly conference, As he hath used of old.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Thou hast described A hot friend cooling: ever note, Lucilius, When love begins to sicken and decay, It useth an enforced ceremony. There are no tricks in plain and simple faith; But hollow men, like horses hot at hand, Make gallant show and promise of their mettle; But when they should endure the bloody spur, They fall their crests, and, like deceitful jades, Sink in the trial. Comes his army on?

lines.speaker: lucilius
lines.text: They mean this night in Sardis to be quarter'd; The greater part, the horse in general, Are come with Cassius.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Hark! he is arrived. March gently on to meet him.
Low march within
Enter CASSIUS and his powers

lines.speaker: cassius
lines.text: Stand, ho!

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Stand, ho! Speak the word along.

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: Stand!

lines.speaker: second soldier
lines.text: Stand!

lines.speaker: third soldier
lines.text: Stand!

lines.speaker: cassius
lines.text: Most noble brother, you have done me wrong.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Judge me, you gods! wrong I mine enemies? And, if not so, how should I wrong a brother?

lines.speaker: cassius
lines.text: Brutus, this sober form of yours hides wrongs; And when you do them--

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Cassius, be content. Speak your griefs softly: I do know you well. Before the eyes of both our armies here, Which should perceive nothing but love from us, Let us not wrangle: bid them move away; Then in my tent, Cassius, enlarge your griefs, And I will give you audience.

lines.speaker: cassius
lines.text: Pindarus, Bid our commanders lead their charges off A little from this ground.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Lucilius, do you the like; and let no man Come to our tent till we have done our conference. Let Lucius and Titinius guard our door.
Exeunt
